statements.name: PROC ODSTEXT
statements.help:
PROC ODSTEXT <CONTENTS=text-string><DATA=SAS-data-set><NAME=template-name>
	<PAGEBREAK=NO | YES><PRINT><=template-store>;
STOREBY <DESCENDING>variable-1
	<… <DESCENDING> variable-n>
	<NOTSORTED>;CELLSTYLE expression-1AS <style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)] >
<, expression-n AS  <style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)]>>;DYNAMIC variable-name-1<=value–1<'text-1'>>
	<variable-name-2<=value-2><'text-2' ...>>;HEADING <n><“heading-text”> / <STYLE=style-override>MVAR variable-name-1<=value–1<'text-1'>>
	<variable-name-2<=value-2><'text-2' ...>>;NMVAR variable-name-1<=value–1<'text-1'>>
	<variable-name-2<=value-2><'text-2' ...>>;LIST  / <START =integer-value><STYLE =style-override> ;
	ITEM <expression> / <FORMAT =format-name>
		<STYLE =style-override>
		<VALUE =integer-value>;END ;P expression/ <FORMAT =format-name><STYLE =style-override> ;TRANSLATE expression-1INTO expression-2< , expression-n INTO  expression-m;>

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Orders the output according to the BY groups.

statements.name: CELLSTYLE
statements.description: For tables, sets the style element of the cells in the table or column according to the values of the variables. For text, sets the style attributes of the list items or paragraphs. Use this statement to set the presentation characteristics (such as foreground color and font face) of individual cells or text.

statements.name: DYNAMIC
statements.description: Defines a symbol that references a value that the data component supplies from the procedure or DATA step.

statements.name: HEADING
statements.description: Creates H# tags for the ODSTEXT output.

statements.name: ITEM
statements.description: Specifies an item to be added to the item list. An ITEM statement that does not specify an expression begins an item block.

statements.name: MVAR
statements.description: Defines a symbol that references a macro variable. ODS uses the value of the variable as a string. References to the macro variable are resolved when ODS binds the template and the data component to produce an output object.

statements.name: NMVAR
statements.description: Defines a symbol that references a macro variable. ODS converts the variable's value to a number (stored as a double) before using it. References to the macro variable are resolved when ODS binds the template and the data component to produce an output object.

statements.name: P
statements.description: Specifies a paragraph. Multiple P statements are allowed within an item block.

statements.name: TRANSLATE
statements.description: Translates the specified numeric values to other values.
